column4: How do you validate what file had access denied?  As an example, Windows has a program made by SysInternals called ProcMon which monitors file/registry access.
How do you validate what file had access denied?  As an example, Windows has a program made by SysInternals called ProcMon which monitors file/registry access.
How do you validate what file had access denied?  As an example, Windows has a program made by SysInternals called ProcMon which monitors file/registry access.
huh? what are you trying to do... linux has it's own permissioning system, I am not sure what you are trying to do
I'm running sudo /usr/lib/nx/nx-node-login test-nx nx 22 nxserver --check
and I get Warning: Identity file not accessible: No such file or directory.  Permission denied (publickey,password)
so I'm trying to find out what file was denied so I can fix it.
can you get a --verbose from that command
doing a little playing around... give me a few min to see if I can do something here... Q. what function is that which you are running? discribe what you are doing, or trying to do
after a little digging, it looks like the filename is blank (double spaces where a file shows in other similar errors on the internet searches)
I'm trying to get freenx to install on a fresh install of 9.10 i386.
it's possible I messed up but, I was following the directions on the page here:  https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FreeNX

I am recovering from a crash ... seems like the command you are using isn't in those instructions... is there a --user option... I think there it may need you to identify as a local user to access an X session... just a thought
I'll deal with it later.  I might try another approach.
